,f Jump to tag into vertical split
[,]gf Go to file [in a vertical split]
gd [i Go to definition (go to variable definition)
^w[←↑↓→] navigate through split buffers
^[⇞⇟],g[tT] navigate through tabulation (next, previous)
localleader \ (default value)
:set (no)cursor(line|column) Hightlight current line or column. Use prefix no to unset
[c ]c In diff mode, navigate through differences http://vimdoc.sourceforge.net/htmldoc/diff.html
:windo diffthis enable diff mode betwenne In diff mode, navigate through differences
<localleader>% jump to the matching tag
:%s/pattern//gn look for a string and find the number of occurrences http://vimdoc.sourceforge.net/htmldoc/tips.html#count-items
g[Uu]w word in Uppercase, (u - lowercase)
vim -p[N] files open N tab pages (default: one for each file)
vim -o[N] files open N horizontal windows (default: one for each file)
vim -O[N] files open N vertical windows (default: one for each file)
vim -d or vimdiff start editing in diff mode
F1 main help file
F2 toggle background colorscheme
F3 make in debug mode OPT=d
F4 make in optimized mode OPT=o
F6 launch Rgrep on current word
F8 launch debugger through ConqueGDB
F10 tag bar
[c or ]c jump backward or forward between changes
:windo diffthis compare buffers
:windo diffoff switch off diff mode
:diffu[pdate] refresh differences
:diffg[et] [buffspec] or do modify the current buffer to undo difference
:diffpu[t] [buffspec] or dp modify another buffer ot undo difference with the current one
[x]>> indent x line(s) by shiftwidth spaces
[x]<< de-indent x line(s) by shiftwidth spaces
[x]== re-indent x line(s)
>% increase indent of a braced or bracketed block (place cursor on brace first)
=% reindent a braced or bracketed block (cursor on brace)
<% decrease indent of a braced or bracketed block (cursor on brace)
]p paste text, aligning indentation with surroundings
=i{ re-indent the "inner block", i.e. the contents of the block
>i{ increase inner block indent
<i{ decrease inner block indent
gg=G Re-indent entire buffer
Vjj> visually mark and then indent 3 (two jj) lines.
This module works with exuberant ctags, and not with gnu version. In AD-Opt environment, the default version is the last one. The workaround is to install the exuberant version into your $HOME/bin folder. Thus, gcmtags script will use that version, because aliases do not work with find -exec command.
